datafield.subfield: Guzhon Moscow Metalworks Hammer and Sickle Factory
Moscow Metalworks Hammer and Sickle Factory
Moskovskiĭ bolʹshoĭ metallurgicheskiĭ zavod "Serp i molot"
Otkrytoe akt︠s︡ionernoe obshchestvo Moskovskiĭ metallurgicheskiĭ zavod "Serp i molot"
Murphy, Kevin. Revolution and counterrevolution, c2005:
CIP galley (Guzhon Moscow Metalworks Hammer and Sickle Factory)

v. 27, p. 251 (Metallurgicheskiĭ zavod "Serp i molot"; began in 1883 when French entrepreneur Guzhon built a workshop for producing wire in Moscow, which eventually became a metall factory. The factory was nationalized in 1918 and renamed "Bolshoĭ metallurgicheskiĭ zavod, byvshiĭ Guzhon" [no publs. in LC data base]. On 7 September 1922 it wa renamed as the Zavod "Serp i molot")

(Metallurgicheskiĭ zavod "Serp i molot" was founded in 1883 by French entrepreneur Zhi︠u︡lem Guzhon as the Tovarishchestvo moskovskogo metallurgicheskogo zavoda [no publs. in LC data base] but was known as the Obshchestvo "Guzhon i Ko" [no publs. in LC data base] or Zavod Guzhona. After the factory was nationalized it was popularly known as the "Byvshiĭ Guzhonovskiĭ zavod". In 1922 it was officially renamed as the Moskovskiĭ bolʹshoĭ metallurgicheskiĭ zavod "Serp i molot". The factory has recently been privatized)

www.sim-st.com (Moskovskiĭ metallurgicheskiĭ zavod "Serp i molot". Founded in 1883, it is one of the oldest factories in the center of Russia. It is now known as the Otkrytoe akt︠s︡ionernoe obshchestvo Moskovskiĭ metallurgicheskiĭ zavod "Serp i molot" (OAO MMZ "Serp i molot"))
(Guzhon I︠U︡liĭ Petrovich, a Russian entrepreneur who founded the Tovarishchestvo moskovskogo metallurgicheskogo zavoda [no publs. in LC data base], now known as the Zavod "Serp i molot")
